nodes.bodyText:
@tvernum This new test failed in a mixed cluster environment. Next steps are:

Mute this test
Merge this PR once approved
Backport and fix the bug in 7.x and merge
Another PR to unmute this test

But I feel it is a bit unwieldy just to stick to the backport workflow. Alternatively I could:

Fix this bug and merge to 7.x (so 7.x will be the shim)
Merge this PR

Please let me know your thoughts on this. Thanks!
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+---
+"Enrich stats query smoke test for mixed cluster":
+
+  - do:
+      enrich.stats: {}
+
+  - length: { coordinator_stats: 3 }

nodes.bodyText: My personal preference is to stick with the standard process of merge to master before backporting, but I don't feel so strongly as to stop you doing what makes sense to you.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+---
+"Enrich stats query smoke test for mixed cluster":
+
+  - do:
+      enrich.stats: {}
+
+  - length: { coordinator_stats: 3 }

nodes.bodyText:
I am happy to following the standard process. No strong opinion here. In fact, I have muted the test so it can be merged first.
But should we get the other 7.x PR to a state where it is almost ready before merging this one? Because as soon as it is merged, a bug is introduced and it can only be fixed by merging the 7.x PR. I'd like to keep the merge time between the two PRs minimal so the bug will not be around for long.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+---
+"Enrich stats query smoke test for mixed cluster":
+
+  - do:
+      enrich.stats: {}
+
+  - length: { coordinator_stats: 3 }
